H0.text: A desert plain is the environment that would most likely have rich, fertile soil.

H1.text: A coastal beach is the environment most likely to have rich, fertile soil.

H2.text: A mountain peak would most likely have rich, fertile soil.

H3.text: A flood plain is the environment most likely to have rich, fertile soil.

A4.text: Because of regular flooding, floodplains frequently have high soil fertility since nutrients are deposited with the flood waters.

A5.text: The decomposition of terrestrial plants submerged by the floodwaters adds to the nutrient supply.
